meanings.definition: (adjective) Given to frequent changes of mood; temperamental.
meanings.sent1: She is the moodiest person I know, always changing how she feels.
meanings.sent2: The weather in spring can be quite moodiest, shifting from sunny to rainy in minutes.
meanings.sent3: The cat acted moodiest, purring one moment and hissing the next.
meanings.sent4: His painting captured the moodiest essence of the stormy sea.
meanings.sent5: The haunted house had the moodiest atmosphere, making visitors uneasy.

meanings.definition: (adverb) In a moody manner; with frequent changes of mood.
meanings.sent1: She looked at him moodiest, unsure of what to say.
meanings.sent2: The clouds moved moodiest across the sky, darkening the landscape.
meanings.sent3: He hummed moodiest while waiting for the bus, lost in thought.
meanings.sent4: The music played moodiest, evoking a sense of melancholy in the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The candle flickered moodiest in the dimly lit room, casting eerie shadows.
